text.div:
Generated Narrative: ImplementationGuide uv-eyecare

OphthalmologyImplementationGuide

The official URL for this implementation guide is: 

https://larfuma.github.io/fhir-eyecare-ig

My attempts at continuing on the development of a Ophtalmologiy Implementation Guide. IMPORTANT: At the moment this IG mostly a fork of the 'Eyes on FHIR' working groups STU 1 Ballot version published here: https://hl7.org/fhir/uv/eyecare/2021Sep/index.html , with minor modifications

name: OphthalmologyImplementationGuide
title: Eyes back on FHIR? An experimental continuation of the Eyes on FHIR working group's HL7 FHIRÂ® IG
description: My attempts at continuing on the development of a Ophtalmologiy Implementation Guide. IMPORTANT: At the moment this IG mostly a fork of the 'Eyes on FHIR' working groups STU 1 Ballot version published here: https://hl7.org/fhir/uv/eyecare/2021Sep/index.html , with minor modifications

extension.valueMarkdown: Automatically added as a dependency - all IGs depend on HL7 Terminology
Automatically added as a dependency - all IGs depend on the HL7 Extension Pack

resource.name: Codes which were needed, but not found in SNOMED or LOINC, will be submitted there
resource.description: Codes which were needed, but not found in SNOMED or LOINC, will be submitted there

resource.name: IOP Methods Code System
resource.description: IOP additional method types

resource.name: Body Structure Qualifiers
resource.description: Additional body site qualifiers

resource.name: Visual field test parameter observations
resource.description: Visual field observation additional codes
Specification any Lens that was n front of an eye during a Visual Acuity test test
Specification of the Lens that was worn during the Visual Acuity test test

resource.name: Ocular anatomical location
resource.description: The description of an ophthalmic anatomical site that is located within the following structures: the eyeball or the periocular or orbital regions (as opposed to non-ocular anatomical locations). This profile is used by combining the unique valueset (hyperlink) for relevant ophthalmic specific BodyStructure.locationQualifier (Body Site modifier) in combination with the base Observation BodyStructure.location (Body Site; descendants from SNOMED 371398005 (Eye Region Structure), each with a preferred binding in order to refine the accuracy of the location decription of occular structures. This unique qualifying element is important because these locations are routinely described either diffently and/or more granularly than other body parts. Of note - non occular (or surrounding) anatomical location references of Observations (eg - arm) do not need to use this modified specialty profile.

resource.name: Ophthalmic Diagnoses
resource.description: A profile to describe the formal past/present clinical diagnosis of a specific non-ophthalmic pathological Condition. As noted above, although the Condition Resource is also referenced in the non-ophthalmic findings profile, this profile is a modification of the base Condition Resource (as opposed to a base Obervation Resource modification, referencing Condition).

resource.name: Ophthalmic diagnostic test report
resource.description: Base profile specifically constrained for describing ophthalmic reports

resource.name: OCT macula Diagnostic Report
resource.description: The DiagnosticReport profile for an OCT macula

resource.name: OCT RNFL Diagnostic Report
resource.description: The DiagnosticReport profile for an OCT RNFL

resource.name: VF Diagnostic Report
resource.description: The DiagnosticReport profile for a visual field DT

resource.name: Base ophthalmic Observation profile
resource.description: Base profile specifically constrained for describing ophthalmic Observations

resource.name: Intraocular Pressure (IOP)
resource.description: A measurement of a patient's intraocular (within the eyeball) pressure (in mmHg).

resource.name: OCT macula Observations
resource.description: The Observations associated with the OCT macula DiagnosticReport (note: this valueset can also be used independently to describe specific findings/Observations captured by a OCT test, which may not necessarily be referenced by the DiagnosticReport.)

resource.name: OCT RFNL Observations
resource.description: The Observations associated with the OCT RNFL DiagnosticReport (note: this valueset can also be used independently to describe specific findings/Observations captured by a OCT test, which may not necessarily be referenced by the DiagnosticReport.)

resource.name: Visual Acuity (VA) V3
resource.description: An assessment of a patients ability to see - Version three

resource.name: Visual Acuity (VA) V2
resource.description: An assessment of a patients ability to see - Version two - simpler structure than Version 1

resource.name: Visual Acuity (VA)
resource.description: An assessment of a patients ability to see.

resource.name: VF Observations
resource.description: The Observations associated with the VF DiagnosticReport (note: this valueset can also be used independently to describe specific findings/Observations captured by a VF test, which may not necessarily be referenced by the DiagnosticReport.)

resource.name: Pupil Function Confounders
resource.description: ValueSet including codes that represent confounders due to pupil function that may affect visual acuity measurements.

resource.name: Visual Acuity Categorical Values
resource.description: ValueSet containing categorical values for visual acuity observations.

resource.name: Ophthalmic anatomical location
resource.description: Describes the ophthalmic structure being referenced

resource.name: Ophthalmology Condition ICD10 and SNOMED codes ValueSet
resource.description: Clinical findings for the eye region.

resource.name: Intraocular pressure (IOP) method valueset
resource.description: Describes the various methods of capturing IOP that relate to the IOP Observation profile

resource.name: Ophthalmology observations (SNOMED)
resource.description: Concept descends from 363926002 - Eye/vision observable (observable entity)

resource.name: Observation Status
resource.description: Describes whether a recorded observation is either final or amended

resource.name: OCT Macula Observable Entities ValueSet
resource.description: OCT Macula observations coding

resource.name: OCT RNFL Observable Entities ValueSet
resource.description: OCT RNFL observations coding

resource.name: Visual acuity method valueset (SNOMED)
resource.description: Describes the visual acuity observation result, where concept descends from 363983007 (Visual acuity)

resource.name: Visual Field Observable Entities ValueSet
resource.description: Visual field observation coding

resource.name: Optotype Presentation ValueSet
resource.description: A ValueSet that includes codes representing the type of optotype presentation used during visual acuity testing.

resource.name: Optotype ValueSet
resource.description: A ValueSet that includes codes representing optotype used during visual acuity testing.

resource.name: Pinhole Occluder Usage Values
resource.description: This ValueSet contains SNOMED CT codes to represent whether a pinhole occluder was used during a visual acuity measurement.

resource.name: Ophthalmology Procedures Valueset
resource.description: This ValueSet represents procedure codes for clinical and billing purposes.

resource.name: Ophthalmic anatomical location qualifiers
resource.description: Describes whether a recorded observation is either final or amended

resource.name: ValueSet-right-left-both-eyes
resource.description: ValueSet containing laterality codes for ophthalmic observations which may contain information on one or both eyes

resource.name: Room Brightness Levels
resource.description: This ValueSet contains codes to represent the brightness of the room where a test was performed.

resource.name: Special VA testing Parameters
resource.description: This ValueSet contains codes to represent whether special testing parameters, such as a pinhole occluder or glare light, were used during a visual acuity measurement.

resource.name: Visual Acuity Correction Methods
resource.description: Methods of correction used during a visual acuity test.

resource.name: Visual Acuity Correction Methods
resource.description: Methods of correction used during a visual acuity test.

resource.name: Visual Acuity Measurement Methods valueset
resource.description: Describes the various charts that can be used to assess visual acuity where concept descends from 400912000 (Visual acuity test equipment (physical object))

resource.name: Visual Acuity Quantity Units
resource.description: Units of Measure of Visual acuity

resource.name: Visual Acuity Test Distance
resource.description: Codes representing the distances at which visual acuity tests are performed.

resource.name: Pupil-Diameter-Comparison
resource.description: A ValueSet containing codes for various pupillomotor function observations.

resource.name: Lens Types
resource.description: This ValueSet includes all SNOMED CT codes that are descendants of 'Contact lenses, device' (57368009) and 'Eye glasses, device' (50121007).

resource.name: Pupil Testing Active Substances
resource.description: This ValueSet contains codes to represent active substances used in pharmacological testing during pupil diameter measurements.

resource.name: ValueSet-right-left-eyes
resource.description: ValueSet containing laterality codes for ophthalmic observations which should only contain information on either the right or left eye, not both
